segments.text: I see the water just spilling everywhere, and the woman doesn’t even care.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: She’s just standing there, drying that plate like it’s the most important thing in the world.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: The puddle is spreading, and she’s just letting it happen.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: I can’t believe how careless she’s being about the mess.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: The children are being sneaky, but at least they’re not making it worse.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: The water is going to ruin the cabinets if it keeps going like this.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: I wish she would just turn around and see what’s happening.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: The garden outside looks so peaceful compared to this mess inside.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: I don’t understand how she can ignore the water like that.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: This is just going to end in a big cleanup later.
segments.speaker: PAR
